EngLawName: Regulations on the Duration of Programs and the Distribution and Number of Advertisements of Satellite Broadcasting Businesses
name: 衛星廣播電視節目起迄時間認定與廣告播送方式及數量分配辦法
histories: 4 Articles promulgated in full by National Communications Commission on November 3, 2016. Ref：Tong-Chuan-Nei-Rong No.10548031480
Promulgated by National Communications Commission on March 20, 2024 in accordance with the order Tong-Chuan-Nei-Rong No.11348005900

articles.content: These regulations are enacted in accordance with the provisions of Paragraph 4, Article 36 of the Satellite Broadcasting Act.

The term“Duration of Programs”in the provisions of Paragraph 4, Article 36 of the Satellite Broadcasting Act refers to a period from the onset of broadcasting program title, graphic, audio or text recognized as the start of the program to the moment before the broadcasting of next program title, graphic, audio or text recognized as the start of the following program.

Advertisements may be broadcast three times in programs that air for up to 30 minutes, and six times in programs that air for up to 60 minutes. For programs that air for more than 60 minutes, the number of advertisements that may be broadcast shall be determined using the aforementioned principle.
For live events, advertisements may be broadcast at appropriate times.
“Advertisements” as referred to in Paragraph 1 include those that are broadcast before or after programs as well as those broadcast during programs.
These regulations shall come into force as of the date of promulgation.
